Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of aluminum to remove contaminants without melting; starting at 100W balances efficiency and safety. Max limited by aluminum's high reflectivity and thermal conductivity to avoid substrate damage. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and study in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on metal cleaning thresholds.
Near-IR wavelength for optimal Aluminum absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution and energy density
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient oxide removal without excessive thermal diffusion
Optimal scanning speed for efficient coverage and cleaning effectiveness
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal pulse overlap for uniform cleaning coverage
